One simple use case in healthcare that focuses on the patient experience and is well-established is the process of filling a prescription.

Traditionally, patients would have to physically visit a pharmacy to drop off a paper prescription and wait for it to be filled. This process can be time-consuming and inconvenient, especially for patients who may have mobility issues or who live far away from a pharmacy.

To improve the patient experience, many healthcare providers and pharmacies have implemented electronic prescription systems, also known as e-prescribing. With e-prescribing, healthcare providers can send prescriptions directly to a patient's preferred pharmacy through a secure electronic network.

This approach provides patients with greater convenience and saves time. Patients no longer need to physically visit a pharmacy to drop off a prescription, as their medication will be ready for pickup when they arrive. Additionally, e-prescribing can help reduce errors, such as illegible handwriting on paper prescriptions.

Moreover, many e-prescribing systems offer additional features that further improve the patient experience, such as automatic refill requests and reminders to pick up medication. This approach also allows for a more streamlined and efficient communication process between healthcare providers and pharmacies.
